data.title: 61 Places To Visit Near Chandigarh With Friends In 2023 (Updated List)
data.meta_description: These places to visit near Chandigarh will win your heart in 2023. From picnics to weekend getaways, there are all kinds of vacations available for you.
data.text:
Chandigarh, the first ever planned city of India, is the epitome of urbanization and metropolitan development. It is also a great getaway to the vibrant hills of Himachal, Uttarakhand and further north. In fact, there are many places to visit near Chandigarh that will offer you instant relief from the hustle-bustle. Located at the foothills of Shivalik or Lesser Himalayas, Chandigarh is a union territory of India and the capital city of Punjab and Haryana. The concept of urban planning evolved in the design and development of Chandigarh. Hence it is an exemplary name in the history of Indian urbanization. Chandigarh, along with two of its neighboring cities of Mohali and Panchkula, is known as the Chandigarh Tricity.

Top 61 Places To Visit Near Chandigarh

We have listed below the most iconic getaways from Chandigarh that you can take with your friends and family. Be it in Himachal, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, or Kashmir, there are plenty of places to visit near Chandigarh that you can explore on your trip in 2023. Find in this list both popular and offbeat locales in varying distances from Chandigarh starting from 100 km and pick the ones that best suit your whims and budget.

9 Places To Visit Near Chandigarh Within 100 KM

If there is a mid-week break and one is desperate for an instant escape from the everyday office chores, here is the list of the best tourist places near Chandigarh for you. These places to visit near Chandigarh are within 100 km. Have a look at these perfect picnic spots near Chandigarh for a short one-day trip:

1. Parwanoo: Family Picnic

Image Source

Timber Trail is a picnic destination in Parwanoo, near Kalka. It is a place with mesmerizing scenic beauty, luxury, and daring adventure. The most interesting part of this picnic spot is that one needs to travel in a ropeway for 3.6 km to reach the venue. The cable car goes over the mighty hills and deep gorges, so keep your cameras ready. It is one of the best places to visit near Chandigarh.

Timber Trail is one of the most preferred picnic places near Chandigarh because of its accessibility and amenities. One can spend the entire day in the property relaxing and rejuvenating. Adventure freaks need not worry! Timber Trail has a lot in store for you too.

Things to do at Timber Trail: Take a cable car ride at Timber Trail Resort, Watch the sunset from Timber Trail Resort, Explore the fruit orchards, Seek blessings at Kali Mata Temple

Best Time To Visit: March to May and October to November

Distance from Chandigarh: 35 km; 40 minutes drive to cable car terminus

Key attractions at Timber Trail: Jaw-dropping view of the surroundings, cycling in the mountains, trekking, spa, and Ayurvedic massages

Must Read: 6 Spine Chilling Bungee Jumping In India

Himachal Holiday Packages On TravelTriangle

2. Morni Hills: Backpackers’ Paradise

Image Source

Morni Hills, located in the Panchkula district, is another very popular picnic spot near Chandigarh. The place is around the lakes which are considered to be sacred by the local villagers. The foothills, the lush green vegetation, the serene lakes, and the mesmerizing Himalayas at a distance together make it one of the favorite picnic spots and tourist places near Chandigarh. It is one of the most easily accessible nearby places to visit near Chandigarh.

Things to do in Morni Hills: Stroll in the forests and witness varieties of flora and birds. Also, go trekking and boating in the lakes.

Best time to visit: September to March

Distance from Chandigarh: 45 km; 1 hour 15 minutes drive

Key attractions in Morni Hills: Tikkar Lake, Mata Baglamukhi Mandir, Samlotha Devi Temple

3. Nalagarh Fort: Historical Sojourn

Image Source

Nalagarh is the doorstep to the hills of Himachal and is an ideal destination for a one-day picnic. The Nalagarh Fort, constructed in 1421 in the kingdom of Raja Bikram Chand, is now a 4-star heritage resort. It is located on a hilltop and offers a breathtaking view of the Shivalik and Sirsa River. People visit Nalagarh Fort mainly for day picnics and spend the entire day with fun, thrill and a wide range of sports and adventure. It is one of the best places to visit nearby Chandigarh.

Things to do in Nalagarh Fort: Discover the historical landmark, see the panoramic view

Best time to visit: October to March

Distance from Chandigarh: 48 km; 1-hour drive

Key attractions at Nalagarh Fort: Ramgarh Fort, Archaeological Museum, Ropar Wetland (Ropar Lake), Gurudwara Bhatha Sahib

Suggested Read: Top 44 Amazing Places To Visit In Uttarakhand

4. Kasauli: Peaceful Retreat

Image Source

Located midway Kalka and Shimla, Sanawar Nature Camp in Kasauli is a perfect picnic spot for people traveling from Chandigarh, Mohali, and Panchkula. It is one of the favorite places to visit near Chandigarh for sports enthusiasts and adventure freaks. They mainly visit this spot and spend the entire day engaged in adventure sports and outdoor games. The camp offers advanced level adventure sports, albeit under proper professional guidance. It is one of the best places to visit for a one day trip near Chandigarh.

Things to do at Sanawar Nature Camp: Trekking Tours – For Adventure Buffs, Gilbert Trail – Refreshing Time In Nature, Hangout Bar – For Party Animals, Gurudwara Sri Guru Nanakji – An Important Religious Centre

Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 52 km; 1.5 hours drive

Key attractions at Sanawar Nature Camp: Mall Road Shimla, Chandigarh International Airport, Kalka Shimla Railway, ChattBir Zoo

5. Barog: Camping Getaway

Image Source

Barog is a small and unexplored hill station near Chandigarh on the Shimla-Kalka Highway. Famous for its charming and quaint railway station, Barog is one of the favorite places near Chandigarh for a quick escape. Less crowded and very attractive, the place is named after a British engineer who was a part of the team responsible for the construction of the narrow gauge railway from Kalka to Shimla. In early days, the train stopped at Barog for almost an hour as the Royal families used to have lavish lunch here. It is among the perfect honeymoon places around Chandigarh where you can spend quality time with your better half.

Things to do in Barog: See the breathtaking sites, Karol Tibba Trek

Best Time To Visit: During the monsoon season

Distance from Chandigarh: 60 km; 1.5 hours drive

Key attractions in Barog: Barog railway station – the prettiest one on the Kalka Shimla track, Barog tunnel – the straightest tunnel in the world, and views of peak Choor Chandni

Suggested Read: 9 Hotels In Mahabaleshwar

Planning your holiday but confused about where to go? These travel stories help you find your best trip ever!

6. Bharatgarh Fort: Family Escapade

Image Source

Constructed in 1783, Bharatgarh Fort is located atop a hill of the Shivalik Range in Ropar district. This is an active fort where the royal family actually resides even today. One portion of the fort is open for tourists. Visit Bharatgarh Fort—as it is one of the popular places near Chandigarh for one day trip, and spend the day enjoying the luxurious facilities, the adventure activities, and the warm hospitality.

Things to do at Bharatgarh Fort: Forest trekking, angling, bird watching, and walking nature trails. Also, do try mouth-watering Punjabi delicacies here.

Best time to visit: During Navratri

Distance from Chandigarh: 65 km; a drive of 1 hour and 20 minutes

Key attractions at Bharatgarh Fort:Anandpur Sahib, Quila Anandgarh Sahib, Virasat-E-Khalsa, Naina Devi Temple

7. Doraha: Thrilling Outing

Image Source

Doraha Sarai, or RDB Fort as it is popularly known, was built as a resting place for Mughal caravans by the Mughal ruler Jahangir. A fine monument in its time, the fort-like structure is in a dilapidated condition now. However, students from the universities of North India find this monument, located 20 km from Ludhiana, an amazing weekend getaway. The monument gained popularity after being used in the popular Bollywood flick Rang De Basanti, and hence the name RDB Fort. It is also known as one of the most romantic honeymoon places near Chandigarh.

Things to do at RDB Fort: Witness the Blue and yellow glazed tiles on archways at the entrance and floral designs on the northern gate, designs of flora and fauna on the southern gate, and visit the terrace on the double-storeyed gateways

Best time to visit: During winter season

Distance from Chandigarg: 81 km which will take around 1 hours 30 minutesKey attractions at Doraha Sarai: Mughal Sarai, Payal Fort, Selfie Falls INC, Alamgir Memorial, Smadh Amar

Suggested Read: 15 Marvellous Places To Visit In Ludhiana

8. Solan: Perfect Road Trip

Image Source

Known as the ‘Mushroom Capital’ of India for its remarkable mushroom production, Solan is one of the most picturesque hill stations in Himachal Pradesh. Located midway between Kalka and Shimla, it has derived the name from Goddess Shoolini Devi – the primary divinity of the region. It is also known as the ‘City of Red Gold’ as it produces vast quantities of tomato. A woodland encircled by hills and mountains, the hill station is chiefly the doorstep to Kasauli, Kalka, and Chail.

Key attractions at Solan: Karol Tibba, Jatoli Shiv Temple, Shoolini Devi Temple, Solan BreweryBest Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 67.5 km and the hilly stretch can be covered in 2 hours.

Key attractions in Solan: Shoolini Mata Temple, Jatoli Shiv Temple, Yungdrung Tibetan Monastery, Gurkha Fort, Karol Tibba, and Mohan Shakti National Park

Stay options in Solan: Himani Resort, Paragon Palace, and Ambusha Resorts

9. Panchkula: Ancient Temples

Image Source

The city of five canals, Panchkula is one of the most nearby places of Chandigarh that anyone can explore in a day. It got its name from the five ancient canals that supply a major amount of water to the Haryana state. Set against Shivalik ranges, there is a lot to explore in Panchkula like ancient temples and Mughal architectures. To sum up the day, you can head to Sector 5 of Panchkula and savor some of the best dishes.

Things to do in Panchulika: Explore Gurudwara and temple, sprawl in the gorgeous park

Best Time To Visit: October to April

Distance from Chandigarh: Around 12 kilometers that can be covered within half an hour.

Key attractions in Panchkula: Cactus Garden, Morni Hills, Mansa Devi Temple, and Nada Sahib.

Suggested Read: 10 Hotels Near Chandigarh

Not all weekends are for movies and eating out. Some weekends can be relaxing and rejoicing too. Just plan for any of these weekend destinations and get set go. These are places to visit near Chandigarh within 150 km that can be reached within 3 hours:

10. Nahan: Serene Lakes

Image Source

The capital of erstwhile Sirmur Princely State, Nahan is a small and very majestic hill station of Himachal Pradesh. Surrounded by serene lakes and heritage temples, it reflects the prettiness of the hills. Nahan had structured the second Municipal Corporation in India after Kolkata. It is one of the popular tourist places near Chandigarh to rejuvenate the mind and soul. If you are planning, here are the details of a weekend getaway to Renuka lake in Nahan, Himachal.

Things to do in Nahan: See the charm of Rani Tal Lake, get to know the ancient history connected to Jaitak Fort, enjoy the panoramic viewBest Time To Visit: April to September

Distance from Chandigarh: 116.8 km; a drive of 3 hours and 30 minutes

Key attractions in Nahan: Renuka Lake, Trilokpur Temples, Suketi Fossil Park, Dhaula Kuan, Renuka Wildlife Sanctuary, Rani Tai, Pakka Talab, and Jaitak Fort

11. Shoghi: Romantic Getaway

Shoghi is one of the must visit places near Chandigarh offering you to relax in the lap of nature. It is a pleasant and appealing weekend destination, located 13 km before Shimla. Quaint slopes, mesmerising oak and pine forests, and tranquil surroundings have made Shoghi an ideal choice among the refreshingly romantic places to visit near Chandigarh.

Things to do in Shoghi: Walking in the woods, trekking along the hills, bird watching, and overnight camping

Best Time To Visit: October to June

Distance from Chandigarh: 104 km; 3 hours drive

Key attractions in Shoghi: Kandaghat, Tara Devi Temple, Hanuman Temple

Suggested Read: Sukhna Lake

12. Chail: Friends’ Escapade

A quiet and peaceful offbeat paradise near Shimla, Chail is the location of the world’s highest cricket ground and the heritage hotel – Chail Palace. Surrounded by lush greenery, mesmerising views, and a dreamy expanse of pine and deodar trees, Chail is among the most serene places to visit near Chandigarh. Once the summer capital of the Patiala kings, this place is now the quintessential destination for travelers seeking a calm and relaxed vacation.

Things to do in Chail: Camping, Rock climbing, Trek from Chail to Gaura and Chail to Jhajja, Nature walk in pine forests

Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 107 km; 3 hours 35 minutes drive

Key attractions in Chail: Maharaja’s Palace, Sidh Baba Ka Mandir, Chail Gurudwara Sahib, Chail Cricket Ground, Chail Palace

13. Kufri: Snow And Solitude

Set in the Shimla district of Himachal, Kufri is one of the most sought-after holiday destinations in India for lovers of hills and nature. Its proximity to Shimla, its high altitude offering dreamy views of cloud-hugging mountains and snow-capped hills make it a preferred destination for all couples and honeymooners whether you choose to visit Kufri in summers of winters. A relatively quiet retreat in comparison to Shimla, Kufri serves as the ideal substitute for the crowded hill stations near Chandigarh offering a range of exciting activities.

Things to do in Kufri: Encountering Wildlife, Amazing Trekking, Thrilling Horse Ride, Exhilarating HikingBest Time To Visit: November to March

Distance from Chandigarh: 128 km; 4 hours 20 minutes drive

Things to do in Kufri: Trekking, skiing, sledging

Suggested Read: 18 Best Things To Do In Chandigarh

14. Naldehra: Majestic Mountains

Image Source

Naldehra, located 22 km upslope of Shimla, is a picturesque holiday destination with splendid valleys, majestic mountains, and amazing sunset & sunrise views. The place is surrounded by alpine and deodar woods, and the vast open stretch is perfect for horse riding.

Things to do in Naldehra: 9-hole golf course, walks along the valley, and horse riding

Best Time To Visit: May to September

Distance from Chandigarh: 137 km; 4.5 hours drive

Key attractions in Naldehra: Tattapani, Kogi Mata Temple, Mahunag Temple, Naldehra Golf Course, Mashobra

15. Theog: Offbeat Retreat

Looking for a quaint place to escape to that is away from the crowd? Then, you must head to Theog which is located in Himachal Pradesh. Blanketed with the mighty Himalayas, Theog is a small hill station which is crowded with tourists. It proves to be a perfect weekend getaway to the lap of nature as it gives a chance to camp.

Things to do in Theog: See the sunset view from the Sunset Point, visit the Christ Church and Mall Road

Best time to visit: October and November

Distance from Chandigarh: 141 kilometers distance from Chandigarh can be covered in nearly 5 hours.

Key attractions in Theog: Fagu, and Hatkoti

Suggested Read: 13 Museums In Chandigarh

16. Assan Barrage: Nature Lover’s Paradise

Another offbeat destination near Chandigarh that you can explore is Assan Barrage that is located in Uttarakhand. Bustling with life along with the richness of nature, Assan Barrage is a bird lover’s paradise as the artificial lake attracts thousands of birds every year. This place also goes by the name Dhaulipur Lake and is teeming with tourists who stay there for some time to marvel at the beauty. It is also one of the perfect places near Chandigarh for one day trip.

Things to do in Assan Barrage: Water skiing, boating, rowing, kayaking, canoeing

Best Time To Visit: October-November

Distance from Chandigarh: 131 kilometers away from Chandigarh; takes 3 and a half hours to cover the distance.

Key attractions in Assan Barrage: Assan Barrage Bird Sanctuary

17. Sirmour: Lakes And Peaches

Image Source

Located in Himachal Pradesh, Sirmour is a tranquil district that is still untouched by industrialization and people from all over India go to this place for a nature retreat. Due to the high cultivation of peaches in this district, Sirmour is also known as the ‘Peach Bowl of India’. Beautiful landscapes, serene lakes, and trekking trails make this place one of the best places for one day trip near Chandigarh.

Things to do in Sirmour: Explore the famous temple of Bala Sundri, enjoy the Renuka fair celebration (in November)

Best Time To Visit:September – June

Distance from Chandigarh: The distance of 122 kilometers can be covered in 3 hours.

Key attractions in Sirmour: Renuka Lake, Simbalbara National Park, and Menri Monastery

Suggested Read: Shopping In Chandigarh

18. Shimla: Himachal’s Crown Jewel

Shimla is one of the top-visited places in India and does not need an introduction. Lofty hills, colonial architecture, and mystical woods of Shimla have attracted several people from the whole of India, as well as the world. Millions of tourists flock to Shimla, especially in the winter season, to witness snowfall and spend some quality time with friends and family. If you are looking for a place to resort to near Chandigarh, then there is no doubt that Shimla is one of the best places to explore in a day.

Things to do in Shimla: Toy Train Ride: Passing Through The Green Hills, Jakhu Temple:Trek To The Top, Camping:Stay Amidst The Woods, Cycling: A Relaxing RideBest Time To Visit: March to June

Distance from Chandigarh: The distance of 114 kilometers can be covered within 4 hours.

Key attractions in Shimla: The Ridge, Mall Road, Christ Church, and Kufri

19. Mashobra: Tranquil Retreat

Perched at a height of 7,700 feet from the sea level, Mashobra is an expansive green place that can be easily reached from Chandigarh. With minimal tourist rush, this place is opted by tourists who want to resort to nature. One of the must visit places near Chandigarh, Mashobra is a perfect weekend getaway place where you can unwind amidst nature.

Things to do in Mashobra: Camping, Biking, Paragliding, Bird WatchingBest Time To Visit:April to June

Distance from Chandigarh: Situated at a distance of approximately 123 kilometers, Mashobra can be reached in 4 and a half hours.

Key attractions in Mashobra: Naldhera and Reserve Forest Sanctuary

Suggested Read: Top 11 Things To Do In Mashobra

20. Tattapani: Quaint Hamlet

Image Source

Tattapani is among the most scenic places near Chandigarh located in Himachal Pradesh. This quaint and peaceful village is situated on the banks of the Satluj river only 60 km away from the city of Shimla. Home to plenty of natural attractions like dense forests, sulphur hot springs, caves, adventure parks, and more, this treasured destination has something to offer to every kind of traveler that comes here. When you’re here don’t miss out on the Shiva Caves that are said to be the center of many Godly miracles and are also believed to fulfil the wishes of visitors.

Things to do in Tattapani: Hot Water Spring, River Rafting in Tattapani, Adventure Park, Trekking and Camping

Best Time To Visit: October to June

Distance from Chandigarh: 131 km (4 hours and 32 minutes)

Key attractions in Tattapani: Hot Water Springs, Shiva Cave, Adventure Park, Mahunag

21. Yamunotri: Yamuna’s Origin

Image Source

Famous as the originating point of river Yamuna, Yamunotri is a respected pilgrim centre and one of the revered tourist places near Chandigarh that pilgrims and worshippers frequent. Tucked in the lap of Garhwal Himalayas at a really high elevation of 3,293 meters above sea level, this natural attraction attracts travelers from far off places with its other-worldly beauty and scenic charm. You’ll be fascinated by the spiritual charm of this place as well as the stunning views of undulating Himalayan peaks surrounding this spot. Don’t forget to check out the Himalayan glaciers and thermal springs at this famed and sacred home of sage Asti.

Things to do at Yamunotri: See the panoramic view of Garhwal Himalayas, visit the famous temple of Goddess Yamuna

Best Time To Visit: May to June and September to November

Distance from Chandigarh: 158 km (5 hours and 38 minutes)

Key attractions in Yamunotri: Janki Chatti, Yamunotri Temple, Hanuman Chatti, Surya Kund, Saptarishi Kund, Divya Shila

Suggested Read: Holi In Mumbai

9 Places To Visit Near Chandigarh Within 200 KM

The weekend break with 2-3 days additional is occasional but eagerly awaited. And for Chandigarh residents, options are just too many. In fact, if you see the list of places to visit near Chandigarh within 200 km, they are all long weekend getaways that will entice you to head out. Have a look:

22. Dehradun: The Gateway To Uttarakhand

Image Source

One of the best tourist places near Chandigarh within 200 km, Dehradun is the doorstep to hilly areas of Mussoorie, Dhanaulti, and Rishikesh. With River Ganga on the East and River Yamuna on the West, the capital of Uttarakhand has been popular for its picturesque views and vast stretches of greenery. The city has held historical importance from the days of Ramayana and Mahabharata. The city also held significant importance during the Ashokan era and Aurangzeb’s rule. It was even invaded by Mahmud of Ghazni.

Things to do in Dehradun: Robber’s Cave: Seek the thrill, Paragliding: Fly in the sky, Mindrolling Monastery: Seek serenity, Nightlife: Groove through the nightBest Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 170 km; 3.5 hours drive

Key atractions in Dehradun: Robber’s Cave, Tapkeshwar Cave, Doon Ice Rink, Mindrolling Monastery, FRI, Tapovan, and Sahastradhara Waterfalls

23. Narkanda: Weekend Excursion

Located at an elevation of 2,708 m on the Hindustan Tibet Road, Narkanda is a perfect weekend spot and one of the well-visited tourist places near Chandigarh. It is a globally famous destination for snowboarding and skiing in India. Narkanda has a picture postcard view surrounded by hills, valleys, alpine meadows, and woods.

Things to do in Narkanda: Skiing, sightseeing view, ancient revered locations

Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 180 km; A drive of 5 hours 30 minutes

Key attractions of Narkanda: Hatu Peak, Kacheri, Jalori Pass, Kotgarh, Thanedar, and skiing and snowboarding

Suggested Read: 30 Budget Honeymoon Destinations In India

24. Rajaji National Park: Adventurous Safaris

Image Source

Spread over a sprawling area of 820 sq km, Rajaji National Park is a wildlife sanctuary, a biosphere reserve, and a habitat to Asian elephants, panther, tiger, leopard, king cobra, Himalayan pied kingfisher, fire tailed sunbird, great pied hornbill, bear, chital, sambar, python, wild boar, and monitor lizards. This national park encompassing Dehradun, Haridwar, and Pauri areas is the first staging ground in India of migratory birds traveling from Siberia. The Ganges flows for 24 km within the park, thereby adding to the beautiful natural backdrop and picturesque beauty.

Things to do in Rajaji National Park: Parasailing, Paragliding, River Rafting and Tubing, spiritual landmarks

Best Time To Visit: Mid November to Mid June

Distance from Chandigarh: 190 km; 4.5 hours’ drive

Key attractions at Rajaji National Park: Jungle Safaris, Rafting on Ganges, Chilla Barrage, Jhilmil Jheel

25. Rishikesh: Pilgrimage And Thrill

Image Source

Rishikesh is spiritual, scenic, and enthralling. It is the world’s yoga capital, India’s adventure capital, and gateway to hills. It is closely located to the north of Valley of Flowers, Kedarnath, Badrinath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri. Also known as the “Place of Sagas”, Rishikesh is a divine destination situated 24 km upstream of Haridwar at the convergence of the Chandrabhaga and Ganga. While being one of the top tourist places near Chandigarh within 200 km, Rishikesh offers you a thrilling extended weekend.

Things to do in Rishikesh: River Rafting, Bungee Jumping, Camping And Bonfire, Flying FoxBest Time To Visit: September to June

Distance from Chandigarh: 200 km; 5 hours’ drive

Key attractions in Rishikesh: Whitewater Rafting, bungee jumping, Ram Jhula, Lakshman Jhula, Triveni Ghat, Bharat Mandir, and Neelkanth Mahadev Temple

Suggested Read: 10 Festivals Of Punjabe

26. Mussoorie: Scenic Waterfalls

Perched atop a mountain valley in Uttarakhand, Mussoorie draws a great influx of travelers every year with its awe-inspiring green hills, old-world colonial architecture, scenic waterfalls, blooming diversity of flora and fauna, and captivating landscapes. Providing the perfect escape from the unforgiving heat in the plains in summers and as a charming white wonderland in winters, Mussoorie is among the best hill stations near Chandigarh for one day trips.

Things to do in Mussoorie: Sightseeing, paragliding, visiting waterfalls in and around the region

Best Time To Visit: September to June

Distance from Chandigarh: 196 km; 5 hours 30 minutes drive

Key attractions in Mussoorie: SOHAM Himalayan Centre, Lal Tibba Scenic Point, Camel’s Back Road, Jabarkhet Nature Reserve, Kempty Falls

27. Chakrata: Trekking Heaven

Looking for places to visit near Chandigarh within 200 km? Chakrata is where you should be headed on your next vacation. A hill station not known to many, Chakrata lies in the sun-kissed Himalayan ranges at an elevation of 2,118 meters. This serene and secluded hill town is surrounded by coniferous jungles and away from the hustle-bustle of city life.

What makes Chakrata a place to visit near Chandigarh is its proximity. Just 197 KM from Chandigarh, Chakrata can be easily reached either by car or state- run buses. The little hilly town is also famous for its trekking trail, cascading waterfalls, and camping.

Things to do in Chakrata: Tiger Falls – Trek All The Way To It, Deoban Forest – Rock Climbing, Kimona Falls – Waterfall Rappelling, Mundali – Go SkiingBest Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 197 KM; 5 hours

Key attractions in Chakrata: Tiger Falls, Kanasar, Lakhamandal, Kalsi

Suggested Read: 28 Offbeat Places In Uttarakhand

28. Bilaspur: Hills And Lakes

Situated in Satluj Valley, Bilaspur is a small town blessed with beautiful hills. The first planned hill town of Himachal Pradesh, Bilaspur is a fun place to spend your weekend in. You can find the hidden lakes where you can swim, find the spots from where you can see the entire town at night. It looks wonderful!

Govind Sagar reservoir in the town is a place where you can go swimming, surfing, rowing, and canoeing etc. One of the best places to visit near Chandigarh within 200 km, Bilaspur won’t disappoint you at all.

Things to do in Bilaspur: Achanakmar Wildlife Sanctuary, explore malls, view of hazy hills

Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Distance from Chandigarh: 118 Km; 3 hours

Key attractions in Bilaspur: Bhakra Dam, Gobind Sagar Lake, Bilaspur Town

29. Haridwar: Religious Retreat

The city of temples, Haridwar is another most-visited destination in India. It is not only a hub of temples and religious spots but also gives a chance to indulge in many thrilling activities.
